metadata.title: CVE-2019-5953 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Buffer overflow in GNU Wget 1.20.1 and earlier allows remote attackers tocause a denial-of-service (DoS) or may execute an arbitrary code viaunspecified vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-5953` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

wget - 1.15-1ubuntu1.14.04.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wget package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.15-1ubuntu1.14.04.5').
